text:
Harold Lederman (January 26, 1940 – May 11, 2019) was an American professional boxing judge and analyst. He began his career as a boxing judge in 1967 and joined the cast of "HBO World Championship Boxing" in 1986. He stayed in this role until HBO dropped boxing in 2018. He was added to the International Boxing Hall of Fame in 2016. He was born in the Bronx, New York. He was a Columbia University graduate.
Lederman died of cancer on May 11, 2019, at the age of 79.
